TopicTitle: Land on the Mun using only SRBs and RCS (Stock parts)

Articles.Content:
Challenge - Lift off from Kerbal and land safely onto the Mun using only SRBs and RCS fuel/thrusters (this means no liquid fuel engines!)

Stock parts only, with the exception of MechJeb or Engineer if you want to use them, I know they make repeated launches / tweaking TWR easier.

I successfully completed this early this morning at around 4am... 

Pics in spoilers...

> 
> The monstrosity that was my rocket...
> 
> ![Z1f8N.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Z1f8N.jpg)
> 
> SRBs alone got me into an orbit with a AP of 516KM and a PE of 106KM, from there it was RCS time...
> 
> ![WYxqW.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/WYxqW.jpg)
> 
> TOUCHDOWN!!! Note how much RCS fuel I had left... I was running on fumes! Looks like this was a one way trip for the poor Kerbals!
> 
> ![UhZuU.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/UhZuU.jpg)
> 
> This took about a dozen tries to get right, its not too bad getting to a Mun orbit using only SRBs and RCS, the hard part was getting into Mun orbit with most of a RCS tank left so I could land! 
> 
>

I really wanted to make a return trip with only SRB/RCS... but it is not to be, my computer is too slow to handle a rocket with 100s of SRBs and struts, I get about .5fps on launch.

My crew landed on their RCS tanks (to great fireworks) and were unfortunately left stranded on the Mun...
You had an entire RCS tank remaining.

Yeah, but I remember reading somewhere that you need at least 2 full RCS tanks to make it back from the Mun.

I think I would have to add 2 more stages to be able to bring one booster on TMI. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
One RCS tank is enough to get a capsule and chute from the Munar surface back to Kerbin, with a minimum of three thrusters, it\'s not easy sure but it\'s not that hard either.
A single solid-fuel rocket booster is also enough to get a capsule, decoupler, and chute from the surface of the Mun back to Kerbin, if you launch from near the trailing pole of the Mun.
Theres somebody around here who has landed on the mun with SRB\'s only, no RCS. If you dig around a bit you should be able to find it. That in my opinion is seriously impressive.
